title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute
Interview Descriptions: I was given two interviews for an instructor in 2015. They went well and I was able to demonstrate my strengths. They were welcoming and understanding. I got to work with an already established instructor to showcase my hands on skills
Interview Questions: Past experience. Leadership skills and ability to work with deadlines.

title: Chemistry Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Application submission on ZipRecruiter then Email correspondence with the program director to determine location and interview availability. Then Zoom interview to discuss professional history and course components. The interview went well so I was asked to prepare a 15 minute presentation to perform for a small number of current staff as well as do a site tour/ meet & greet.
Interview Questions: Experience, availability, location, salary expectations

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute
Interview Descriptions: Timely interview from application to screening followed by two panel interviews. Each panel consisted of 3-4 individuals who each had their opportunity to ask questions. Each interview was approximately one hour in duration.
Interview Questions: Good leaders encourage lasting behaviors and habits in their team. Can you identify a good habit to be practiced?

title: Financial Aid Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute
Interview Descriptions: The process was not too hard but took more than one interview. The interviewers were very friendly and asked great questions to determine if I was a great candidate and would fit the company culture.
Interview Questions: Why was I looking to work for Pima.

title: Career Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute
Interview Descriptions: Seamless. Everything was great. Typical. Via zoom. Basic.  Send in resume. May take a while for response. Very personable interviewer. Be yourself. Be honest. Know your resume. Behavioral questions. Smile.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time you went above & beyond for a colleague

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Tucson, AZ) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was provided with a screening interview followed by a panel interview. The interview process was approximately two weeks until I heard back from the hiring manager. The interview panel was professional and welcoming.
Interview Questions: All questions focused on the competencies for the position.

title: Career Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute
Interview Descriptions: Very  communicative and went smoothly through out the entire process. They also got back to me in a very timely manner while still respecting my work hours with my previous employer.
Interview Questions: How would you approach a student who has is getting not so good feedback from their externship site?

title: Campus Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Colorado Springs, CO) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Because this is a campus leader position, there was an initial phone screening with HR that consisted of four interview questions.  I also got to ask questions about the role and the company culture was described to me as an ESOP organization.
Interview Questions: 1.  What is your understanding of Pima?

title: Admission Support Center Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy and quick. After applying I was contacted a few weeks after and I went through two interviews and after was offered the position. The staff who interviewed me were great and gave a lot of information concerning the job and expectations.
Interview Questions: What was the best supervisor I had and why?

title: Career Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Renton, WA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: The day after applying for the position,  I received a call and had a short phone interview. Then I had an 30 minute online, Zoom interview with the Career Services Coordinator. Then I had an on-site interview where I got a quick tour of the campus, got to meet a few people, and had the interview with the coordinator and the Campus Director. Afterwards, I had a final Zoom 30 minute interview with the coordinator, another advisor, and the Associate Campus Director. I did not get the offer but everyone was very nice and pleasant!
Interview Questions: How would your co-workers or employers describe you?

title: Dental Hygienist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Was great and nervous at the same time. I really like the formatting for the interview. For anyone getting ready for interview please practice and be ready don’t practice the day before!
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in the dental field.

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
1. Initial phone interview
2. Invited to campus for panel interview (2 hours)
3. I was sent a written assessment to complete (timed)
4. Zoom Interview with Corporate (panel)
5. 2nd interview on campus with key management
6. Offer
Interview Questions: They asked about the regulatory experience.

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (San Marcos, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process began with a phone screening by the HR department. Following that, it was a phone interview that lasted about 30 minutes, and a few days later I got a call that I would be meeting with the Regional Director for Pima. That was about a 1.5-2 hour interview that felt like having a fun but thorough and lengthy conversation. After that I then interviewed with the CEO and 5 or so community partners, due to the nature of the role and all of the parties that I would be working with. It was a panel interview that took place in the conference room and maybe lasted about 1 hour.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot about my professional background and quite a few hypothetical scenarios that were relevant to the job.

title: Financial Aid Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Chula Vista, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I went through 3 panel interviews and after each interview I admired Pima as a company even more. They told me the reason for the 3 interviews was for the initial meeting you get the interview side of the candidate. After the second and third the candidate tends to open up more to get a glimpse of their personality. They gave me tour of the campus too which was appreciated.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good candidate for the position?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (East Mesa, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: There were 6 of us. A panel of 4 were conducting the interview. They spoke about the founder and the culture and took us on a tour of the school.
Interview Questions:
What's your morning routine?
Are you a hunter or a farmer?
What's the last best thing you've done?(then went on to say that the last group had someone who donated his kidney)

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Mesa, AZ) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first contact was a 20 minute phone interview.  The manager was very nice and made it very easy to talk.  The second step was a group interview that was more on a personal level.
Interview Questions: Who was your favorite teacher and why?

title: Nursing Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Tucson, AZ) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Absolute worse interview I have ever been involved in.  Very unprofessional. Made no eye contact.  Spoke down to me.  Very negative experience .  Would never work in this environment.  With the shortage of nursing instructors can's believe they treat potential instructors this way.
Interview Questions: What hospital do you work at?  I am an NP do not work in a hospital. Want clinical instructors only but did not make this clear when they called for an interview. Big waste of everyone's time. How would you teach conceptual nursing?

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (El Paso, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, Pima does not make you suffer. If you are the ideal candidate, they make you an offer you cannot refuse. They make you feel like you are already hired.
Interview Questions: About my experience.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Chula Vista, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with direct supervisor then got called into an interview with the two directors Met with direct supervisor and faculty director some student director.  Each interview took no more than 30 minutes and by that point both parties we OK with ending the interview.
Interview Questions: What is one characteristic about you that student could relate to?

title: Medical Career Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Mesa, AZ) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was efficient, friendly and relaxed. After arriving on-site at the campus, I only had to wait a few minutes in the lobby and was met by the interviewer and escorted to a board room where the interview was conducted. I interviewed with 2 hiring managers which the position reports to. Both were friendly and professional. I was hopeful and expecting to be hired, but in the end I wasn't their first choice. Hopefully next time.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Houston, TX) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I did my extern ship from PIMA Medical Institute at the Buckingham. It was not a job but a place that I could practice my skills. It was not an interview.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to follow the path of being a nursing assistant

title: MA Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Mesa, AZ) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It took amidst a month to get hired on. They did a panel group interview at first, then they had a one-on-one interview, then they did a mock- teaching interview, then they had me come in for a final interview with two people. It was ridiculous for only $15 an hour....
Interview Questions: How I would handle students that were older than me and questioned my experience.

title: Faculty Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Albuquerque, NM) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Working interview since I was selected to be Interim Faculty Coordinator. Prior to this role, however, I was first an instructor. For this particular role I had a panel interview with the Campus Director and Faculty Coordinator, then I administered a lecture presentation to a Career Prep class while being observed by an instructor and the Faculty Coordinator.
Interview Questions: What qualifies you for this position?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Tucson, AZ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with the recruiter and the Director of Human Resources for my first interview at the Corporate office. I had taken a PI ahead of time. Then I had a second interview one on one with the Director of Human Resources that was more in depth and getting to know the position and my strengths in accordance, and then there was a panel interview with the whole team where they each asked me questions about myself.
Interview Questions: Situational, tell me about a project you worked on; accomplishment you're proud of..

title: Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The position was posted for internal employees.  Resumes were sent to the Campus Director and he set up face to face interview times.  The interview was conducted by the Campus Director and the Associate Campus Director.  After all interviews they selected me.
Interview Questions:
If given the position what would I do in the first 90 days/
If we select someone else for this position what will you do?

title: Payroll Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute
Interview Descriptions: I went to two interviews one with the supervisors and then one with the staff I would be working with.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were standard questions.

title: Career Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Renton, WA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: FIrst Interview is a phone interview.  General screening to make sure you have the background that closely related to the position.  2nd inteview is in person panel interview with 6 or 7 other candidates.  They ask each of us a question and everyone has a chance to answer.  I passed through, to the final interview which was with the school president.  After making it this far and being the overwhelming favorite, I was given an offer of $17 an hour.  this was well below my requirements, as well as fair pay for the responsibilities incldued.  As much as I wanted to opportunity, I had to pass.  I know my worth and they were not willing to invest in me and the future of their students.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions.....I held this position before at a competing school, so I breezed through the process.

title: School Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Denver, CO) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was positive and inspiring and I felt like she answered all my questions and I answered hers. Since I was a graduate of Pima Medical Institute and had worked in a physicians office. The Director new that I had the skills need to do the job required. So she asked me when I could start the position and I said as soon as you need me I could start.
Interview Questions: When can you start

title: Campus Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pima Medical Institute (Houston, TX) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Submit your resume online to the Corporate Office or directly to a Campus Director.
Interview Questions: Greatest professional or personal achievement.
